ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Superior Semicircular Canal Dehiscence (SSCD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by Tullio phenomenon, low-frequency air-bone gaps with normal tympanometry, and reduced cVEMP thresholds.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Vestibular Disorder (Lithium Toxicity)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Long-term Lithium use likely causing observed saccadic eye movements and downbeat nystagmus.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Perilymphatic Fistula
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to pressure-induced dizziness, but less likely given the reduced cVEMP thresholds which suggest dehiscence.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Migraine
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of migraines present, but specific mechanical triggers (sound/pressure) strongly favor a third window pathology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and check for air-bone gaps associated with third window lesions.
To evaluate middle ear function and rule out middle ear pathology as cause of conductive loss.
To assess retrocochlear function and confirm intact reflex arc despite air-bone gaps.
To evaluate vestibular function, oculomotor status, and presence of nystagmus.
To assess otolith function and check for reduced thresholds indicative of SSCD.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry revealed a mild low-frequency conductive hearing loss with air-bone gaps at 250 Hz bilaterally, despite normal middle ear function (normal tympanograms and reflexes). This dissociation is a hallmark of Third Window Syndrome. VNG testing showed central signs (saccades, downbeat nystagmus) attributed to long-term Lithium use, and a mild right caloric weakness. cVEMP testing confirmed the suspicion of SSCD with a significantly reduced threshold and increased amplitude in the left ear, along with an observed Tullio phenomenon during testing.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild bilateral conductive hearing loss at 250 Hz with air-bone gaps of 30 dB (Right) and 20 dB (Left). Normal hearing sensitivity in mid-to-high frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Speech recognition thresholds (SRT) and word recognition scores (WRS) within normal limits bilaterally (100%).

tests.name: Other (VNG)
tests.result_summary: No spontaneous nystagmus; robust saccadic eye movements (Lithium effect); high-frequency headshake elicited downbeat nystagmus; 23% right caloric weakness.

tests.name: Other (cVEMP)
tests.result_summary: 51% asymmetry (Left > Right); Left ear threshold reduced to 65 dB nHL; Tullio phenomenon (vertigo/nystagmus) observed during left ear stimulation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Imaging studies were conducted to confirm the diagnosis. The MRI was negative, ruling out retrocochlear lesions. The CT scan confirmed bilateral Superior Semicircular Canal Dehiscence (SSCD), consistent with the audiological findings.

tests.name: MRI of internal auditory canals and brain
CT scan of temporal bones
tests.result_summary: Revealed bilateral Superior Semicircular Canal Dehiscence (SSCD).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: One week post-surgery (left superior semicircular canal plugging), the patient reported significant improvement with only occasional vertigo. Objective testing showed resolution of the third window effect and expected post-surgical vestibular signs.

tests.name: VNG (Post-surgical)
tests.result_summary: Mild right beat nystagmus post-headshake; downbeating nystagmus in head-hanging position (expected outcome of canal plugging).

tests.name: cVEMP (Post-surgical)
tests.result_summary: Reduced left threshold response no longer present; results within normal limits.

tests.name: Bithermal Caloric Irrigations (Post-surgical)
tests.result_summary: No change in horizontal semicircular canal function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Six months post-surgery, the patient was fully resolved of all symptoms, denied falls, and was able to walk unassisted. Follow-up testing confirmed successful compensation.

tests.name: VNG (Post-surgical follow-up)
tests.result_summary: No evidence of downbeating nystagmus on headshake or head-hanging positional testing.

tests.name: Clinical Status
tests.result_summary: Patient fully resolved of all symptoms, denied falls, and was able to walk unassisted.

proposed_items: CT scan of temporal bones to confirm dehiscence
Surgical repair (plugging of the superior semicircular canal) via middle fossa craniotomy
counseling_actions: Explain the 'Third Window' mechanism causing dizziness with loud sounds (Tullio) and pressure.
Discuss the impact of long-term Lithium use on eye movements (saccades) versus the peripheral pathology.
Counsel on surgical options (plugging vs resurfacing) and associated risks, including sensorineural hearing loss.

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for CT imaging to confirm SSCD and discussion of surgical management options.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor symptom resolution, vestibular compensation, and surgical outcomes.

expected_outcome: At 1 week postsurgery, patient reported significant improvement in symptoms with only occasional vertigo.
Post-surgical VNG (1 week): Mild right beat nystagmus post-headshake and downbeating nystagmus in head-hanging position (expected outcome of canal plugging).
Post-surgical cVEMP: The reduced left threshold response was no longer present; results returned to within normal limits.
Post-surgical Bithermal Caloric Irrigations: No change in horizontal semicircular canal function.
At 6 months postoperative: No evidence of downbeating nystagmus on headshake or head-hanging positional testing.
At 6 months postoperative: Patient was fully resolved of all symptoms, denied falls, and was able to walk unassisted.
